findings.title: CCR - Contract Centralization Risk
findings.description: The `unlockAcceleration` function grants the contract owner the ability to selectively unlock tokens for specific users, posing centralization risks including Single Point of Control, Vulnerability to Attacks, Operational Delays, Trust Dependencies, and Decentralization Erosion.

findings.title: RFB - Referral Fee Bypass
findings.description: The contract allows users to specify a `_referrer` address when purchasing Basalt tokens through the `buyBasaltTokens` function. However, it lacks a check to prevent users from entering their own address as the `_referrer`, enabling them to bypass the intended referral mechanism and avoid paying the referrer fee.

findings.title: RC - Repetitive Calculations
findings.description: The contract contains methods with multiple occurrences of the same calculation being performed without utilizing a variable to store its result, leading to redundant code, hindered code readability, and increased gas consumption.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: DPI - Decimals Precision Inconsistency
findings.description: Inconsistency in handling decimals field of ERC20 token can cause problems when interacting with contracts, resulting in unexpected outcomes.

findings.title: EIS - Excessively Integer Size
findings.description: The contract uses a bigger unsigned integer data type than necessary, consuming more storage space and requiring additional computational resources, resulting in higher transaction costs, longer execution times, and potential scalability bottlenecks.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Non-conformance to Solidity naming conventions can lead to decreased readability and maintainability of the code.

findings.title: L11 - Unnecessary Boolean equality
findings.description: Boolean equality is unnecessary when comparing two boolean values.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured with user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The contract does not specify a stable compiler version, which may lead to unexpected behavior and undiscovered bugs.
